column4: I'm trying to connect to Windows share, but it rejects my (correct) password/username, what can be wrong?
sudo apt-get install smbfs
i have smbfs installed
try mounting from the command line
mount error(13): Permission denied
sudo mount -t smbfs //192.168.1.xxx/share /media/mountpoint -o username=drizzt  ?
mm.. sure the pass is correct? lower/upper case?
of course
smbclient -L 192.168.1.xxx   returns the share?
session setup failed: NT_STATUS_LOGON_FAILURE
seems to be a username pass thing??   connecting to windows? or a samba server?
yes it windows server, and name.pass are correct because I can connect from another win machine in same network
which version of windows server?
XP Professional
Usually its the other way around! Very confisuing..
in nautilus, can you navigate to smb://ipaddress and see the share?
it keeps asking for password, but won't accept it
im stumped..  on windows XP , set up another folder, share it.. and make sure your username is in the permissions list..  try to connect to that share with the username
it's the same password loop for that new shared folder
but works from Windows.....
mmm im stumped..  manually, when you do -o username xxxxx .. xxxx = your username on the xp machine (i know, ridiculosu question, but no hard im checking)
yes, i'm providing correct username both in mount and smbclient
im stumped then.. probably a good idea to troll the forums and see.. this seems very trivial..
